qas.question: Orlam clans crossed which river to migrate to Namibia?
What area of Namibia did Orlam clans settle in?
When did Orlam clans settle in Namibia?
When did the Nama-Herero war begin?
Who deployed troops to start the Nama-Herero war?
What type of people were the San?
In what year did the Nama-Herero War hostilities stop?
What type of people were the Damara?
What type of people were the Herero tribe?

context: The dry lands of Namibia were inhabited since early times by San, Damara, Nama and, since about the 14th century AD, by immigrating Bantu who came with the Bantu expansion from central Africa. From the late <a2_0>18th century<a2_0/> onwards, Orlam clans from the Cape Colony crossed the <a0_0>Orange River<a0_0/> and moved into the area that today is <a1_0>southern Namibia<a1_0/>. Their encounters with the <b5_0><b7_0><b8_0>nomadic<b8_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/> Nama tribes were largely peaceful. The missionaries accompanying the Orlams were well received by them, the right to use waterholes and grazing was granted against an annual payment. On their way further northwards, however, the Orlams encountered clans of the Herero tribe at Windhoek, Gobabis, and Okahandja which were less accommodating. The Nama-Herero War broke out in <a3_0><b6_0>1880<b6_0/><a3_0/>, with hostilities ebbing only when <a4_0>Imperial Germany<a4_0/> deployed troops to the contested places and cemented the status quo between Nama, Orlams, and Herero.
